question: What is the zfill function doing in this script?

answers.answer: It is not necessary, let's remove it
It allows the strings to concatenate
answers.feedback: Incorrect! The '+' does the concatenation. Try again.

answers.answer: It adds spaces to the strings
It fills the string with zeros until a particular number is reached
answers.feedback: Correct! In this case it fills the content of variable i with zeros until 2 numbers are reached. So 1 becomes 01, 2 becomes 02 etc. When i equals 10, no zero is added because that value already consists of two characters. Numbers with preceding zeros also sort easier as strings (e.g. 001,002,003...,009,010,099,100) instead of the default (1,10,100,2,3,4,5,6... ) so use it frequently!
